title: GMail display has all text in white boxes after FF update to 91
content: Since the auto update to FF 91, my Gmail does not display correctly as it did with previous version of FF. The text is dark or colored letters in little white boxes. These boxes were the same as the background in the older version of FF. Any Ideas of how to fix this or do I have to go back to an earlier version of FF. The issue with that is the pop up that warns of an earlier version and creates a new Profile every time it is opened.. If I have to go back what version is recommended? I'm running Big Sur on a Macbook Pro..

title: Unable to open hyperlinks in Firefox 91.0.1
content:

If I right click on the link I can open in either a new tab or a new window.

This does not happen in Safari. Any ideas?

title: ALL PREVIOUS FORMS USE TO LOAD BEFORE THE LATEST FIREFOX UPDATE
content:
Since Firefox's inception, I've never had a problem with previous site sign-in forms populating such as Gmail or any other usually visited site, that is, until I accidentally updated to the latest Firefox version, because of my dread in suffering major problems with almost every update; and the Firefox team or community nearly always refusing to assist as of late. Let's see if this time is different.

I checked my settings and the settings are good for forms, so I am puzzled.

I also noticed that gmail began timing out and disconnecting, "again", as occurred with a previous update that corrupted the gmail notification add-on - something that took me a year to figure out, because no one cared to help. Boo hoo! Well, the new Gmail notification add-on is now also corrupted with the latest Firefox update, and so I had to abandon that one as well.

I sure would love to know why no one there will tell me how to turn the Firefox version update "off". It's only the 7th time in a row, that an update has ruined my business capability, making add-ons malfunction or to stop working, or to loose valuable information. I want to scream like you can't believe.

Help me please!
creator: cvmenn

title: Stupid Toolbar Context Menu
content:
Sorry I'm just frustrated lol. I have configured my add ons the way I want to. Some of them will activate what I need most of the time with just a click. however sometimes I will need to bring up the context menu.

But if I click anywhere on the length of the toolbar outside search I only get two useless options. "customize toolbar and enter/exit fullscreen". I can right click the apps if they're in overflow, but only the apps in overflow, meaning I can either have full functionality of my apps or quick access but not both. I couldn't find any configs to solve this.

I am pulling my hairout, I genuinely don't understand why you wouldn't want to be able to use right click on your most used apps. It's so counter intuitive to me I'm convinced I'm doing something wrong.

title: single out certain Google cookies to accept
content:
Firefox removes all cookies when I shut it down; that is the option I have chosen. I know I can opt out of this by allowing cookies for certain websites. 

I don't want to allow Google/Youtube cookies in this way: I don't want Google to come back the next time and continue to build their cookie cache; I want them to start with a "Google cookie free" browser.

But.....

This means I have to set my Google cookie settings every time I start my browser and visit any of the Google sites. This annoys me a lot.

Is it possible to single out certain cookies (e.g. the one with the Google cookie settings) that I want to keep, while I remove all the other Google cookies on shut down?

(Before you suggest: not using Google/Youtube is not an option).

Thanx,


Thom

title: 10+ years of browser history gone
content: firefox browser history disappeared after deleting appdata temp folder. windows 10 pc using ccleaner i "cleaned" the ...\appdata\local\temp\ folder all browser history has disappeared is gone. i have 4 firefox profiles and even the 2 profiles that i have not used in more than 8 months have been wiped clean. unfortunately the appdata branch is not part of any of my backup routines. i had always thought that the FF profiles contained all the browser history and was rather shocked to see all my curated history was gone. fortunately i did not loose the extensive bookmarks. why would browser history be stored only in a temp folder? any ideas??
